        public int dim

      • fields

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int dim)
        creates a Board with a three dimensional array fields based on the dim. The array is filled with an empty Mark
        Parameters:
        dim, - an integer that indicates the dimensions of the board.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        Returns a copy of this Board. Creates a new instance of Board with the same dim and copies fields.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of this Board with the same references.

      • isField

        public boolean isField(int x,
                       int y,
                       int z)
        Returns whether or not the parameter coordinates correspond with a field on the board.
        Parameters:
        x, - integer representing x coordinate.
        y, - integer representing y coordinate.
        z, - integer representing z coordinate.
        Returns:
        whether or not the parameter coordinates correspond with a field.

      • isField

        public boolean isField(int x,
                       int y)
        Returns whether or not the parameter coordinates correspond with a field on the board.
        Parameters:
        x, - integer representing x coordinate.
        y, - integer representing y coordinate.
        Returns:
        whether or not the parameter coordinates correspond with a field.

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField(int x,
                            int y,
                            int z)
        Checks the the parameters using isField() and returns if the corresponding field is empty.
        Parameters:
        x, - integer representing x coordinate.
        y, - integer representing y coordinate.
        z, - integer representing z coordinate.
        Returns:
        whether or not the parameter coordinates point to a empty field.

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField(int x,
                            int y)
        returns whether or not the corresponding field has place for another Mark. If maximum height is reached it will return false.
        Parameters:
        x, - integer representing x coordinate.
        y, - integer representing y coordinate.
        Returns:
        returns whether or not the corresponding field has place for another Mark.

      • isEmptyLayer

        public boolean isEmptyLayer(int z)
        Checks whether or not the input layer contains only empty fields.
        Parameters:
        z, - integer representing layer to check.
        Returns:
        whether or not the whole layer is empty.

      • getField

        public Mark getField(int x,
                     int y,
                     int z)
        Returns Mark at the corresponding field if the field exists.
        Parameters:
        x, - integer representing x coordinate.
        y, - integer representing y coordinate.
        z, - integer representing z coordinate.
        Returns:
        Mark at the corresponding field.

      • setField

        public void setField(int x,
                     int y,
                     int z,
                     Mark m)
        Sets the input Mark at the input field if the field exists.
        Parameters:
        x, - integer representing x coordinate.
        y, - integer representing y coordinate.
        z, - integer representing z coordinate.
        m, - Mark to put at the corresponding field.

      • setTopField

        public void setTopField(int x,
                        int y,
                        Mark m)
        Sets input Mark at the top of input field if the field is valid and empty.
        Parameters:
        x, - integer representing x coordinate.
        y, - integer representing y coordinate.
        m, - Mark to put at the top of corresponding field.

      • has1DLine

        public boolean has1DLine(Mark m)
        Checks whether or not the Board contains a one-dimensional line containing four of the input Mark. Examples of a one dimensional line: x = 1, y = 3, z = 2.
        Parameters:
        m, - Mark that the line should contain.
        Returns:
        whether or not the Board contains a one-dimensional line containing four of the input Mark.

      • has2DLine

        public boolean has2DLine(Mark m)
        Checks whether or not the Board contains a two-dimensional line containing four of the input Mark. With a two dimensional line we mean a line in a two-dimensional plane.
        Parameters:
        m, - Mark that the line should contain.
        Returns:
        whether or not the Board contains a two-dimensional line containing four of the input Mark.

      • has3DLine

        public boolean has3DLine(Mark m)
        Checks whether or not the Board contains a three-dimensional line containing four of the input Mark. With a three-dimensional line we mean the diagonals of the cube that represents the playing field.
        Parameters:
        m, - Mark that the line should contain.
        Returns:
        whether or not the Board contains a three-dimensional line containing four of the input Mark.

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner(Mark m)
        Checks whether or not the input Mark has a line on the Board of four pieces.
        Parameters:
        m, - the winning Mark to check for.
        Returns:
        whether or not the input Mark has won the game.

      • hasWinner

        public boolean hasWinner()
        Checks whether or not the board has a winner using both Marks in isWinner().
        Returns:
        whether or not the board has a winner.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks whether or not all fields are full using isEmptyField().
        Returns:
        whether or not all fields are full.
